title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: Hello! I got an 820-2936 board here that was not turning on. I fixed it and now it turns on, but sometimes fans go high and machine gets extremely slow. I then decided to run ASD to see if there are any sensor errors. But, neither ASD EFI or ASD OS show me the option to test sensors. It simply won't show up sensors test option on the tests list. Never seen this happen before! Same ASD works ok on another machine, so not DMG problem. Any ideas on what it could be? I'm suspecting maybe BIOS is bad as I had to flash it because costumer had interrupted a system update and corrupted original BIOS.

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message:
Did you flash with clean ME region for sure?
If changed serial number, was Fsys checksum fixed?

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: I could not copy FSYS from original bios, it was unreadable. Actually somehow original chip got fried. I flashed a supposedly clean BIOS from my database, which I already had used before and worked on other machines. Yes, I put client's serial on it.

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message:
Fsys checksum must be fixed, if serial number is changed.
Why didn't test without changing the BIOS file?

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message:
Because BIOS could not be read. I needed to change even the chip itself as it was fried... Machine was not starting with it.

Edit... Ah, I understood now what you said... Will test without putting costumer's serial in it. Will post back, thanks!

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: Part of the EFI contains sensor-related configuration. Maybe you just flashed a bad file.

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: Was what I thought... I will try flashing it again. Do you have any known good clean file for 2936?

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Z7qre3hePqv5E35NjRN-O91ejyNGuSv4/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
It is already posted on the forum somewhere...

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: I will try flashing your file to test. Anyway, I flashed mine again and now it shows up sensors on ASD. Palmrest sensor is reading wrong. I tried replacing Trackpad and cable, but same results... Full speed fan and laggy trackpad. I think it may be some communication dateline that's wrong. I'm trying to figure out how palmist temperature measuring works, but cannot find any clues on schematics.

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: Don't forget to test disconnecting webcam.

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: Tried with webcam disconnected. Same results

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: Now it’s worse! 4 sensors are reading wrong. TC0D, TC0P, TM0P and Ts0P. All of them telling SMC IO failure

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message:
Which was the initial problem?
Any liquid sign on the board?
If yes, should reball SMC.

Give it a try removing R5222/23.

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: Board had some corrosion. SMC has been reballed. Board was not turning on when it arrived. I think I’ll try to reball it again because today when I reflores it the machine worked for some hours and now it stopped again. Will try those resistors as well

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message: If I press my finger on the chip machine works again for some time then starts giving ASD errors again

title: 820-2936 Strange Behavior on ASD
message:
Reball SMC again.
Be sure to get good solders on its balls.
